data.title: Death and Funeral Notices
data.meta_description:
Livestream Funeral Services

Livestreaming of Funeral Services is available for families who request us to arrange this service.

To watch a livestream Service, please refer to the Death and Funeral notices on this page and if the Service is to be livestreamed a link to click 'HERE' will be placed in the notice a few days prior
data.text:
Livestream Funeral Services

Livestreaming of Funeral Services is available for families who request us to arrange this service.

To watch a livestream Service, please refer to the Death and Funeral notices on this page and if the Service is to be livestreamed a link to click ‘HERE’ will be placed in the notice a few days prior to the Service. Click the link approx 15 minutes prior to the Service. Then click on the arrow in the centre of the opening screen and the Service will commence at the time advised.

At the completion of the Service the link will become inactive until the following day, the Service can then be watched again on the same link.

The video link will stay active for several weeks.

Please note – you will never be asked for credit card or bank details to view a livestream

If you have any difficulty accessing the link, please call us and we will be happy to assist you.

THOMAS, Andrew Anthony ‘Andy’

Let go forward! Let go AFT! Let the bells ring out! Our best friends crossed the bar!

Unexpectedly on 19 August 2024, aged 74 years.

Much loved husband of Ray of 50 years.

Loved ‘Old Man’ of Sonya and Selby; and Tristan (d).

Beloved Poppy Andy of Danny and Xavier.

Desperately missed by Billy, his furry partner in crime.

Just tell me old shipmates, I’m taking a trip mates. And I’ll see you someday on Fiddlers Green.

Andy’s family invite family and friends to a celebration of Andy’s life to be held on Friday 30 August 2024 at 2:00pm at the family home, 82 Cockatoo Lane, Sandy Creek.

Click HERE to join Andy’s celebration of life service via livestream.

Send a Condolence Message

HAHN, Ruth Gloria Ruth (nee Biele)

8.7.1938 ~ 20.7.2024

Dearly loved wife of Norman.

Loving mother and mother-in-law of Lynette and Ken; Chris and Julie; Kathryn and Brett.

Treasured Grandma of Nicole and Tim; Nathan and Sammi; Ryan and Crystal; Gabby; Jesse and Jess; Tiarna and James; Noah and Beth; Trent and Jarrod.

Adored Great-Grandma of Aquila, Kieren, Mackenzie, Toby; Logan; Jack, Milo; Charlie and Ava.

We have been blessed by your 86 years of faith, love, courage and kindness.

Thank you to the dedicated and caring staff at Barossa Village.

Safe in the arms of Jesus.

A celebration of Ruth’s life will be held at the Strait Gate Lutheran Church, Light Pass on Tuesday 30 July 2024 at 10:30am, followed by her committal in the adjoining cemetery.

Donations in memory of Ruth, in lieu of flowers, to Dementia Australia, can be made online or at the service.

Send a Condolence Message

ABINETT, Dylan “Dilshan”

Passed away suddenly on 21 June 2024.

Dearly loved son of Peter, loved by Deb.

Cherished brother of Jake, Tiffany and Matt, Maddison and Bryan.

Loved dearly by Little Nanna.

Loved and respected by all of his mates.

Keep bowling those tweakers and rest easy in paradise Dilshan.

Forever 32.

The celebration of Dylan’s life will be held in the Tanunda Oval Clubrooms on Wednesday 24 July 2024 at 2.00 pm. The Clubrooms are adjacent the Tanunda Showhall and access will be available from Bilyara Road and Elizabeth Street.

Click HERE to join the celebration of Dylan’s life by livestream.

Donations in memory of Dylan can be made to the Animal Welfare League online or envelopes will be available on the day.

Send a Condolence Message

SMITH, Melva Helen (nee Saegenschnitter)

26 October 1934 – 2 July 2024

Passed away peacefully at home.

So much loved and admired.

Loved and loving daughter of Ida Helene Regina and Benjamin Alwin Saegenschnitter (both dec).

Dearly loved and cherished wife of Donald.

Much loved Mum and Mother-in-Law of Kerstin and Allan, Greg and Michelle.

Adored Nan and Nan-in-Law of Grant and Lisa, Joel and Hayley.

Big Nan to Olivia, Stella and Jude.

Treasured sister of John (dec), Valerie and Verno (dec).

In all our hearts forever. You will be deeply missed. We love you.

Melva’s family invite all who wish to attend a Service to Celebrate her life to be held on Friday 12 July 2024 at 10.30 am in the Barossa Funerals Chapel, 51 Basedow Road Tanunda, followed by Melva’s committal in the St John’s Cemetery, Tanunda.

Send a Condolence Message

ABRAHAM, Robert Eric George ‘Bob’

Sadly passed away on 26 June 2024.

Aged 83 years.

Dearly loved husband of Ros for 61 wonderful years.

Loved Dad of Gavin and Janine; Steve and Tricia.

Loved Poppa of Jonathan and Emily.

Safe in the arms of Jesus.

The Service to celebrate Bob’s life will be held on Tuesday 9 July 2024 at 2.00 pm in the Barossa Funerals Chapel, 51 Basedow Road Tanunda.

To join the Service by livestream click HERE

In lieu of flowers a donation in memory of Bob to Medecins Sans Frontieres – Doctors without Borders, would be appreciated by his family. Envelopes will be available at the Service or can be made online by clicking HERE

Send a Condolence Message

TOMPKINS Denis Cave

26/12/1939 – 26/06/2024

Dearly loved and loving husband of Jan.

Loving, dependable and treasured Father and Father-in-Law with Josephine, of Susanne and Michael, Anthony and Natalie, Craig and Monica.

Adored Poppy of Daniel, Nicholas, Gemma, Alice, and Sophie.

Beloved and respected Stepfather to Susan and Woody, Karen and Dean, and Carolyn and Tommy.

Cherished Poppy to Marcus(d), Zali, Calley, Tayla, Braydon, Zoey-J, and Bella.

Thank you to Dr Adams and the staff at Angaston Hospital for their care of Denis.

Forever in our hearts and memories.

A celebration of Denis’ life will be held on Friday 5 July 2024 at 1:00pm in Our Lady of the Valley Catholic Church, 26 Gawler Street, Nuriootpa.

Denis’ committal will follow in St John’s Lutheran Cemetery, Tanunda.

Donations to the Tanunda RSL appreciated and can be made at the church.

Send a Condolence Message

GUYMER, Blair Edward

Treasured Son of Elaine and George (dec). Friend of Errol.

Beloved Husband of Corrie.

Devoted Father of Liam.

Adored Father of Lily.

Loving Father of Emily, and dedicated Poppy G of Lleyton.

Dearly loved brother and brother-in-law of Kim and Michael. Much loved Uncle of Jayden, Maeghan and Elijah.

Beloved son-in-law of Cheryle and Gus (dec).

Cherished brother-in-law to Mark and Jodee, Uncle to Cooper, Annabel, Ebony, Alex and Zoey-bug.

Forever loved Brother, Brother-in-law and Uncle to Adam, Kristin, Mitch and AJ.

Loved by Uncle David, Aunty Lana, William and Matthew.

The celebration of Blair’s life will be held on Friday 28 June 2024 at 2.00 pm in the Old Redemption Cellar, Peter Lehmann Wines, Para Road, Tanunda.

In lieu of flowers a donation in memory of Blair to the Royal Flying Doctor Service SA/NT would be appreciated by his family. Envelopes will be available.

To join the celebration of Blair’s life via livestream click HERE

Send a Condolence Message

HUEPPAUFF, Eileen Myrtle (nee Keller)

formerly Kruger

Passed away peacefully on Tuesday 11 June 2024 in the Tanunda Lutheran Home.

Aged 87 years.

Loved wife of Erwin Kruger (dec).

Loving wife of Syd Hueppauff (dec).

Loving Mother of Roger, David, Dion, Sherie (dec); Peter, John, Barry (dec) and Christopher.

Loved Mother-in-Law and Grandmother.

You never failed to do your best, Your heart was true and tender. You simply lived for those you loved, And those you loved remember.

Eileen’s family would sincerely like to thank Dr Fraser Vivian and the staff at Tanunda Lutheran Home for their care.

Eileen’s family invite all who wish to attend a Service to celebrate her life to be held in the Bethany Lutheran Church, Bethany Road, Bethany on Friday 21 June 2024 at 10:30am to be followed by Eileen’s committal in the Bethany Cemetery.

To join Eileen’s Service via livestream click HERE

Send a Condolence Message

GIERKE, Samuel Ross (Sam)

25/9/1979 – 25/4/2024

It is with deep regret the families of Sam announce his passing due to a brave fight with cancer.

Adored and loving Husband of Michael.

Dearly loved son of Ross and Ramona and son-in-law of Carolyn and Peter (dec.).

Adored brother and bother-in-law of Ben and Megan, Johann and Marcia, Heidi, twin brother of Klaus and Kate, Anna (dec.), Dane (dec.).

Treasured and dearly loved uncle of Tyler, Madi, Sven, Isla, Maya, Oli, Owen, Macie (Godchild) and Lulu.

Loved brother-in-law of Danny and Mandy.

Loving father of fur babies Frog and Cricket.

Your loving and caring nature has left an enormous hole in our family, we will miss you everyday.

Our comfort now lies in knowing that you are safe in the arms of Jesus Christ our Saviour.

Sam’s family invite all who wish to attend a Service to Celebrate his life on Saturday 4 May 2024 at 1:00pm in the St Stephen’s Lutheran Church, Nildottie, followed by his committal in the adjoining cemetery.

Click HERE to join Sam’s service via livestream.

Donations to the Cancer Council “Biggest Morning Tea’” can be made at the service.

Please wear bright colours.

Send a Condolence Message

SCHLIEBS, Margaret May (nee Weber)

Passed away peacefully on 17 April 2024 at Barossa Village. In her 90th year.

Loved and cherished wife of Ken (dec) for 66 years.

Much loved mother and mother-in-law of Kathryn and Ray, Bronwyn and Roy, Jacquelyn (dec) and Christopher, Brett and Tanya.

Much loved Grandma of Melinda & Mark, Kyle & Hayley, Joshua & Lexi, Shaun, Travis & Juanita, Ellen & Brock, Claire & Justin, Georgia & Tim, Daniel.

Great-Grandma of Brandon; Ruby & Margot; Milo & Felix; Sebastian; Sadie & Tully; Jack & Samuel.

We little knew that morning, God was going to call your name.

In life we loved you dearly, in death we do the same.

It broke our hearts to lose you, you did not go alone.

For part of us went with you, the day God called you home.

You left us beautiful memories, your love is still our guide.

And though we cannot see you, you are always at our side

Our family chain is broken, and nothing seems the same.

But as God calls us one by one, the chain will link again.

The family wish to thank the staff, doctors and pastors at Barossa Village for their continuing care and support.

Relatives and friends are invited to attend the Funeral Service for Margaret, to be held on Monday 29 April 2024 at 11:00am in the Langmeil Lutheran Church, Maria Street, Tanunda followed by Margaret’s committal in the Siegersdorf Cemetery.

To join the Service by livestream click HERE

Send a Condolence Message

MOORE, Patricia Dawn “Trish”

Passed away 3 April 2024.

Aged 85 years.

Much loved sister of Lynn, Janice and John.

Cherished sister-in-law of Lynnette, Alan and Jennifer.

Adored special aunty to her 12 nieces and nephews and their partners and children.

Inspired forever by her independence, strength and loving care for her family and friends.

All welcome to the celebration of Trish’s life to be held in its entirety in the St Petri Lutheran Church, 21 Second Street, Nuriootpa on Saturday 20 April 2024 at 2:00pm.

Click HERE to join Patricia’s service via livestream.

In lieu of flowers, donations in Patricia’s memory can be made to Cancer Council SA. Envelopes will be available at the service.

Send a Condolence Message

CUNDY, Keith Vincent

11.06.1951 – 01.04.2024

Passed away after a very long courageous battle with cancer.

Dearly and much-loved Husband of Cheryl.

Loving Father to Jason, Damien, Melissa and Deb.

Treasured Grandpa and Pappa of Kyle, Makayla, Amelia and Blake.

Your fight was tough and your pain was cruel. Your love for us all was immeasurable. We all have such wonderful memories of a dedicated, hard-working man who was a provider. You were a truly inspirational person who has taught us to be strong and never lose sight of our goals, even if life gets challenging.

Now resting in peace. Forever in our Hearts.

Keith’s family invite all who wish to attend a Service to celebrate his life to be held in the Bethany Lutheran Church, Bethany Road, Bethany, on Friday 12 April 2024 at 1:30pm, to be followed by a private committal.

Send a Condolence Message

LINDNER, Ross Gerald

Born 2 March 1923. Called to his eternal home on 11 March 2024.

Aged 101 years.

Beloved and cherished husband of the late Lorna Irene (nee Kerber).

Beloved and devoted father of David, Betty, John, Kaye and June (dec) and their families.

Precious in the sight of the LORD is the death of His saints.

Relatives and friends are invited to attend the Funeral Service for Ross, to be held on Wednesday 20 March 2024 at 10:30am in the Bethany Lutheran Church, Bethany, to be followed by a private committal.

Visitation prior to the Service at 9:45am to 10:00am.

Send a Condolence Message

PENDERGAST, Leon Gary

21.5.1971 ~ 7.2.2024

Dearly loved husband of Kylie.

Adored father of Grace, Lachie and Liam.

Treasured son of Rae and brother Rhoul.

Beloved son-in-law of Ray and Geraldine.

Forever missed by family and friends.

Always in our hearts.

A celebration of Leon’s life will be held on Friday 23 February 2024 at 2:00pm in the Old Redemption Cellar, Peter Lehmann Wines, Para Road, Tanunda.

Leon’s committal will be held privately at the Keyneton Lutheran Cemetery.

Click HERE to join Leon’s service via livestream. (Melbourne viewers please note livestream will commence at 2:30pm AEST)

Send a Condolence Message

MALONE, Terance “Terry”

Terry passed away on 9 February 2024.

Aged 80 years.

Loved son of the late Paddy and Doris.

Much loved husband of Marlene for over 50 years.

Loving Dad of Fiona and Sean.

Loved by Andrew, Sonia, Kerry.

Cherished Grandad of Stuart and Misha, Craig; Declan and Lucy, Kieran.

Precious Great Grandad of Arla.

“I’m not afraid of dying, I just don’t want to be there when it happens”.

Terry’s family invite all who wish to attend a Service to Celebrate his life, to be held on Friday 23 February 2024 at 10.30 am, in the Barossa Funerals Chapel, 51 Basedow Road, Tanunda.

Send a Condolence Message

GIERSCH, Raymond Edwin

Passed away peacefully on 27 January 2024.

Aged 89 years.

Reunited with Lorna after 10 years.

Dearly loved father of Peter, Christine, Graham and Lee.

Loved Grandpa to Kirsten and Travis, Jasmine and Adrian, Bianca and James.

Loved Great-Grandpa to Sahvanna, Eden, Olivia, Milla, Matilda, Jake, Liam, Elsie and Indie.

Ray’s family thank the staff of Tanunda Lutheran Home for their care.

Now resting in God’s care.

Ray’s family welcome all to his Funeral Service, on Monday 5 February 2024 at 1:00pm in the Gramp Chapel, 27 Bridge Street, Tanunda with his committal in the Tabor Cemetery.

All welcome to the Celebration of Ray’s life in the Tanunda Football Clubrooms from 2:00pm.

Donations in Ray’s memory can be made to Parkinson’s SA. Envelopes will be available at the service.

Send a Condolence Message

ROHRLACH, Rita Lorna (nee Rosenzweig)

Passed away peacefully on 21 January 2024.

Aged 88 years.

Loving wife of Arthur (dec).

Caring, loving Mum of Betty (dec), Andrew and Faith, and Nanna of Nathan and Tailar and Great-Grandmother of Ezra.

Safe in the arms of Jesus.

Andrew and Faith welcome relatives and friends to the celebration of Rita’s life, on Monday 5 February 2024 at 10:00am at Impact Church Barossa, Dorrien, to be followed by her committal in the Tabor Cemetery, Tanunda.

Send a Condolence Message

GRAETZ, Dorothy Elinor Rita (nee Steicke)

Elinor passed away peacefully on 23 January 2024.

Aged 95 years.

Dearly loved wife of Merv (dec).

Loved mother and mother-in-law of Heather and Brian, Wilfred (dec), Lynette and Kym, Elizabeth and Andrew.

Loving Grandma of Wendy and Tim, Michael, Jennifer and Gregg, Richard; Renee, Melanie, Deanne; Jonathon and Anita, Toby, Jemima and Matthew, Mercy.

Proud Great Grandma of Fletcher, Rupert, Adelaide, Theodore; Abigail and Audrey.

Called home to be with her Lord.

All are welcome to attend Elinor’s Funeral Service to be held in the St John’s Lutheran Church, 11 Jane Place, Tanunda, on Friday 2 February 2024 at 10.30 am, to be followed by Elinor’s committal in the Nuriootpa Cemetery.

Send a Condolence Message

SCHMAAL, Phillip Michael

Passed away peacefully at home with his family on 20 January 2024.

Aged 65 years.

Beloved partner of Kari, and children Kat and Matt, Mikey and Alicia, and Georgia.

Adored Dad of Libby and partner Scott.

Much loved son of Eddie (dec) and Ronda, twin brother of Keryll and brother-in-law Drew and big brother of Janine.

A respected gentle man.

All welcome to the celebration of Phil’s life to be held on Thursday 1 February 2024 at 2:00pm in the Zion Lutheran Church, 85 Murray Street, Angaston.

Click HERE to join Phil’s service via livestream.

Donations in Phil’s memory can be made to Cancer Council SA.

Send a Condolence Message

PROEVE, Kaylene Suzanne

21-11-1952 ~ 16-1-2024

Dearly loved wife of David.

Adored mother of Clara and Andrew, mother-in-law of Greg and Grandma of Joshua and Elijah (dec).

Safe in the arms of Jesus.

A celebration of Kaylene’s life will be held at Langmeil Lutheran Church, Maria Street, Tanunda on Wednesday 31 January 2024 at 2:00pm with her committal in the Langmeil Cemetery.

Please wear bright colours.

Click HERE to join Kaylene’s service via livestream.

Donations in memory of Kaylene can be made to Dementia Australia. Envelopes will be available at the service.

Send a Condolence Message

SCHOPP, Norma Joyce (nee Klingberg)

6 April 1948 – 13 January 2024

Devoted and loving wife to Roy for 57 years. Loving and caring mother and mother-in-law of Craig and Kristen, and Allyson and Daniel. Cherished Grandma of Madeline and Jasmine, Karl and Maddy, and Sarah.

Loved daughter of Phil and Jean (both dec.) and sister of Dorothy (dec), Yvonne, Kevin, Graham, Robyn, Cathryn, John and Karen.

No farewell words were spoken, no time to say goodbye.

You were gone before we knew it, and only God knows why.

Now resting peacefully in the arms of her Lord.

Forever in our hearts.

All welcome to the celebration of Norma’s life on Wednesday 24 January 2024 at 11:00am in St Paul’s Lutheran Church, Short Terrace, Balaklava.

Click HERE to join Norma’s service via livestream.

Donations in memory of Norma to the Fred Hollows Foundation can be made online www.hollows.org or at the service.

Send a Condolence Message

DUTSCHKE, Bradley Owen

Brad passed away peacefully at home surrounded by his loving family.

Dearly loved husband of Laurene Jill, approaching 60 wonderful years.

Much loved Dad and Father-in-law of Richard and Lisa, Greg and Simone, Lynelle and John, Matt and Sophiah, Nathan and Beck.

Adored Poppa of Sharnee and Jace, Chloe and Joe, Jarrod and Claire, Johanna and Cam, Emma and Tom, Jackson, Addison, and Jake.

Loving Goppa of Sahara, Peyton, and Harper.

Awaiting the Resurrection.

Jill and family would like to invite all who knew Brad to attend a Service to Celebrate his life to be held Wednesday 24 January 2024 at 10:30am in the St Petri Lutheran Church, 21 Second Street, Nuriootpa, to be followed by Brad’s committal in the Tabor Cemetery, Tanunda, at 1:30pm.

Click HERE to join Brad’s service via livestream.

Send a Condolence Message

MICKAN, Adrienne May (nee Schulz)

Passed away peacefully on 12 January 2024.

Aged 89 years.

Dearly loved wife of Rex for 70 years.

Loving mother and mother-in-law of Andrew and Nicola, Julie and Stephen, Lisa and Kym.

Loved Nanna of Sean, Amy; Megan, Jordan.

Great Nanna to Levi and Mason.

I know she will be walking beside me every day ~ Rex

There will never be a day we don’t think about you. You are always in our hearts.

Thank you to all the staff in the Acacia Ward at Tanunda Lutheran Home.

As was Adrienne’s wishes, a private cremation has been held.

Send a Condolence Message

PRIOR, David Lindsay

Passed away peacefully surrounded by family at The Royal Adelaide Hospital, on 5 January 2024.

Aged 69 years.

Father of Amy and Emma.

Thank you to everyone who has been a part of David’s life.

The members of the Tanunda Men’s Shed, the House of Hope and the Uniting Church at Nuriootpa, for friendships shared.

Special thanks to all who cared for David when he needed. Doctors and Staff at the Nuriootpa Medical Centre, SA Ambulance, Lyell McEwin Hospital and the ICU at the RAH.

We thank you all.

A Service of Thanksgiving to celebrate David’s life will be held on Thursday 18 January 2024 at 10.00am in the Nuriootpa Uniting Church, 56 Murray Street, Nuriootpa. Following refreshments, we will reconvene for David’s committal in the Kapunda Cemetery at 1.00 pm.

Send a Condolence Message

LOFFLER, Owen Wesley

Owen passed away peacefully in the Lyell McEwin Hospital on 4 January 2024.

Aged 61 years.

Owen will be dearly missed by his loving sisters, Sandra, Lois, Wendy (dec), and their families.

Our memories will last forever.

Relatives and friends are invited to attend the Funeral Service for Owen, to be held on Wednesday 17 January 2024 at 11.00 am in the Barossa Funerals Chapel, 51 Basedow Road Tanunda, followed by Owen’s committal in the Tabor Cemetery, Tanunda.

Send a Condolence Message
